div.p: SIRIUM, in botany; a genus of plants belonging to the claſs of tetra ndria and order of mοnοgynia. The calyx is quadrifid ; there is no corolla ; the nectarium is quadriphyllous and crowning the throat of the calyx ; the germen is below the corolla; the ſtigma is trifid, and the berry trilocular. There is only one ſpecies, the myrtifolium.
